IsEnabled.description: Indicates if ABS is enabled. True = Enabled. False = Disabled.

IsEngaged.description: Indicates if ABS is currently regulating brake pressure. True = Engaged. False = Not Engaged.

IsError.description: Indicates if ABS incurred an error condition. True = Error. False = No Error.

ActiveAutonomyLevel.comment: Follows https://www.sae.org/news/2019/01/sae-updates-j3016-automated-driving-graphic taxonomy. For SAE levels 3 and 4 the system is required to alert the driver before it will disengage. Level 4 systems are required to reach a safe state even if a driver does not take over. Only level 5 systems are required to not rely on a driver at all. While level 2 systems require the driver to be monitoring the system at all times, many level 2 systems, often termed "level 2.5" systems, do warn the driver shortly before reaching their operational limits, therefore we also support the DISENGAGING state for SAE_2.
ActiveAutonomyLevel.description: Indicates the currently active level of autonomy according to SAE J3016 taxonomy.

IsActive.description: Indicates if cruise control system is active (i.e. actively controls speed). True = Active. False = Inactive.

IsEnabled.description: Indicates if cruise control system is enabled (e.g. ready to receive configurations and settings) True = Enabled. False = Disabled.

IsError.description: Indicates if cruise control system incurred an error condition. True = Error. False = No Error.

SpeedSet.description: Set cruise control speed in kilometers per hour.

IsEnabled.description: Indicates if EBA is enabled. True = Enabled. False = Disabled.

IsEngaged.description: Indicates if EBA is currently regulating brake pressure. True = Engaged. False = Not Engaged.

IsError.description: Indicates if EBA incurred an error condition. True = Error. False = No Error.

IsEnabled.description: Indicates if EBD is enabled. True = Enabled. False = Disabled.

IsEngaged.description: Indicates if EBD is currently regulating vehicle brakeforce distribution. True = Engaged. False = Not Engaged.

IsError.description: Indicates if EBD incurred an error condition. True = Error. False = No Error.

IsEnabled.description: Indicates if ESC is enabled. True = Enabled. False = Disabled.

IsEngaged.description: Indicates if ESC is currently regulating vehicle stability. True = Engaged. False = Not Engaged.

IsError.description: Indicates if ESC incurred an error condition. True = Error. False = No Error.

IsEnabled.description: Indicates if lane departure detection system is enabled. True = Enabled. False = Disabled.

IsError.description: Indicates if lane departure system incurred an error condition. True = Error. False = No Error.

IsWarning.description: Indicates if lane departure detection registered a lane departure.

LaneDepartureDetection.description: Signals from Lane Departure Detection System.

IsEnabled.description: Indicates if obstacle sensor system is enabled (i.e. monitoring for obstacles). True = Enabled. False = Disabled.

IsError.description: Indicates if obstacle sensor system incurred an error condition. True = Error. False = No Error.

IsWarning.description: Indicates if obstacle sensor system registered an obstacle.

SupportedAutonomyLevel.description: Indicates the highest level of autonomy according to SAE J3016 taxonomy the vehicle is capable of.

IsEnabled.description: Indicates if TCS is enabled. True = Enabled. False = Disabled.

IsEngaged.description: Indicates if TCS is currently regulating traction. True = Engaged. False = Not Engaged.

IsError.description: Indicates if TCS incurred an error condition. True = Error. False = No Error.

ADAS.description: All Advanced Driver Assist Systems data.

Acceleration.description: Spatial acceleration. Axis definitions according to ISO 8855.

AmbientAirTemperature.description: Ambient air temperature outside the vehicle.

AngularVelocity.description: Spatial rotation. Axis definitions according to ISO 8855.

AverageSpeed.description: Average speed for the current trip.

BodyType.description: Body type code as defined by ISO 3779.

IsOpen.description: Hood open or closed. True = Open. False = Closed.

IsActive.description: Horn active or inactive. True = Active. False = Inactive.

IsHeatingOn.description: Mirror Heater on or off. True = Heater On. False = Heater Off.

Pan.description: Mirror pan as a percent. 0 = Center Position. 100 = Fully Left Position. -100 = Fully Right Position.

Tilt.description: Mirror tilt as a percent. 0 = Center Position. 100 = Fully Upward Position. -100 = Fully Downward Position.

IsHeatingOn.description: Mirror Heater on or off. True = Heater On. False = Heater Off.

Pan.description: Mirror pan as a percent. 0 = Center Position. 100 = Fully Left Position. -100 = Fully Right Position.

Tilt.description: Mirror tilt as a percent. 0 = Center Position. 100 = Fully Upward Position. -100 = Fully Downward Position.

Intensity.description: Rain intensity. 0 = Dry, No Rain. 100 = Covered.

RearMainSpoilerPosition.description: Rear spoiler position, 0% = Spoiler fully stowed. 100% = Spoiler fully exposed.

RefuelPosition.description: Location of the fuel cap or charge port.

IsLocked.description: Is trunk locked or unlocked. True = Locked. False = Unlocked.

IsOpen.description: Trunk open or closed. True = Open. False = Closed.

IsLocked.description: Is trunk locked or unlocked. True = Locked. False = Unlocked.

IsOpen.description: Trunk open or closed. True = Open. False = Closed.

IsHeatingOn.description: Windshield heater status. False - off, True - on.

IsLevelLow.description: Low level indication for washer fluid. True = Level Low. False = Level OK.

Level.description: Washer fluid level as a percent. 0 = Empty. 100 = Full.

IsHeatingOn.description: Windshield heater status. False - off, True - on.

IsLevelLow.description: Low level indication for washer fluid. True = Level Low. False = Level OK.

Level.description: Washer fluid level as a percent. 0 = Empty. 100 = Full.

IsChildLockActive.description: Is door child lock engaged. True = Engaged. False = Disengaged.

IsLocked.description: Is door locked or unlocked. True = Locked. False = Unlocked.

Position.description: Position of window blind. 0 = Fully retracted. 100 = Fully deployed.

Switch.description: Switch controlling sliding action such as window, sunroof, or blind.

IsChildLockEngaged.description: Is window child lock engaged. True = Engaged. False = Disengaged.

Position.description: Window position. 0 = Fully closed 100 = Fully opened.

Switch.description: Switch controlling sliding action such as window, sunroof, or blind.

Left.description: All doors, including windows and switches.

Right.description: All doors, including windows and switches.

Row2.description: All doors, including windows and switches.

Door.description: All doors, including windows and switches.

DriverPosition.comment: Default value is position 1, i.e. a typical LHD vehicle.
DriverPosition.description: The position of the driver seat in row 1.

AmbientAirTemperature.description: Ambient air temperature inside the vehicle.

Left.description: HVAC for single station in the vehicle

Right.description: HVAC for single station in the vehicle

Row1.description: HVAC for single station in the vehicle

CurrentLanguage.description: ISO 639-1 standard language code for the current HMI

DateFormat.description: Date format used in the current HMI

DistanceUnit.description: Distance unit used in the current HMI

EVEconomyUnits.description: EV fuel economy unit used in the current HMI

FuelEconomyUnits.description: Fuel economy unit used in the current HMI

TemperatureUnit.description: Temperature unit used in the current HMI

TimeFormat.description: Time format used in the current HMI

DeclinedURI.description: URI of suggested media that was declined

URI.description: User Resource associated with the media

Played.description: Collection of signals updated in concert when a new media is played

SelectedURI.description: URI of suggested media that was selected

Latitude.description: Latitude of destination according to WGS 84.

Longitude.description: Longitude of destination according to WGS 84.

AmbientLight.description: How much ambient light is detected in cabin. 0 = No ambient light. 100 = Full brightness

IsDomeOn.description: Is central dome light light on

LightIntensity.description: Intensity of the interior lights. 0 = Off. 100 = Full brightness.

IsLeftOn.description: Is light on the left side switched on

IsRightOn.description: Is light on the right side switched on

IsSharedOn.description: Is a shared light across a specific row on

Row1.description: Spotlight for a specific area in the vehicle.

IsLeftOn.description: Is light on the left side switched on

IsRightOn.description: Is light on the right side switched on

IsSharedOn.description: Is a shared light across a specific row on

Row2.description: Spotlight for a specific area in the vehicle.

IsLeftOn.description: Is light on the left side switched on

IsRightOn.description: Is light on the right side switched on

IsSharedOn.description: Is a shared light across a specific row on

Row3.description: Spotlight for a specific area in the vehicle.

IsLeftOn.description: Is light on the left side switched on

IsRightOn.description: Is light on the right side switched on

IsSharedOn.description: Is a shared light across a specific row on

Row4.description: Spotlight for a specific area in the vehicle.

Spotlight.description: Spotlight for a specific area in the vehicle.

Position.description: Position of window blind. 0 = Fully retracted. 100 = Fully deployed.

Switch.description: Switch controlling sliding action such as window, sunroof, or blind.

DimmingLevel.description: Dimming level of rearview mirror. 0 = undimmed. 100 = fully dimmed.

IsDeployed.description: Airbag deployment status. True = Airbag deployed. False = Airbag not deployed.

Height.description: Height of lumbar support. Position is relative within available movable range of the lumbar support. 0 = Lowermost position supported.

Support.description: Lumbar support (in/out position). 0 = Innermost position. 100 = Outermost position.

Lumbar.description: Adjustable lumbar support mechanisms in seats allow the user to change the seat back shape.

Recline.comment: Seat z-axis depends on seat tilt. This means that movement of backrest due to seat tilting will not affect Backrest.Recline as long as the angle between Seating and Backrest are constant. Absolute recline relative to vehicle z-axis can be calculated as Tilt + Backrest.Recline.
Recline.description: Backrest recline compared to seat z-axis (seat vertical axis). 0 degrees = Upright/Vertical backrest. Negative degrees for forward recline. Positive degrees for backward recline.

Support.description: Side bolster support. 0 = Minimum support (widest side bolster setting). 100 = Maximum support.

SideBolster.description: Backrest side bolster (lumbar side support) settings.

Backrest.description: Describes signals related to the backrest of the seat.

Angle.description: Headrest angle, relative to backrest, 0 degrees if parallel to backrest, Positive degrees = tilted forward.

Height.description: Position of headrest relative to movable range of the head rest. 0 = Bottommost position supported.

Heating.description: Seat cooling / heating. 0 = off. -100 = max cold. +100 = max heat.

Height.description: Seat position on vehicle z-axis. Position is relative within available movable range of the seating. 0 = Lowermost position supported.

IsOccupied.description: Does the seat have a passenger in it.

Massage.description: Seat massage level. 0 = off. 100 = max massage.

Issuer.description: Unique Issuer for the authentication of the occupant. E.g. https://accounts.funcorp.com.

Subject.description: Subject for the authentication of the occupant. E.g. UserID 7331677.

Position.description: Seat position on vehicle x-axis. Position is relative to the frontmost position supported by the seat. 0 = Frontmost position supported.

Length.description: Length adjustment of seating. 0 = Adjustable part of seating in rearmost position (Shortest length of seating).

Seating.comment: Seating is here considered as the part of the seat that supports the thighs. Additional cushions (if any) for support of lower legs is not covered by this branch.
Seating.description: Describes signals related to the seating/base of the seat.

IsLessSupportEngaged.description: Is switch for less lumbar support engaged (SingleSeat.Backrest.Lumbar.Support).

IsMoreSupportEngaged.description: Is switch for more lumbar support engaged (SingleSeat.Backrest.Lumbar.Support).

IsLessSupportEngaged.description: Is switch for less side bolster support engaged (SingleSeat.Backrest.SideBolster.Support).

IsMoreSupportEngaged.description: Is switch for more side bolster support engaged (SingleSeat.Backrest.SideBolster.Support).

Backrest.description: Describes switches related to the backrest of the seat.

IsBackwardEngaged.description: Is switch to decrease seating length engaged (SingleSeat.Seating.Length).

IsForwardEngaged.description: Is switch to increase seating length engaged (SingleSeat.Seating.Length).

Seating.description: Describes switches related to the seating of the seat.

Tilt.description: Tilting of seat relative to vehicle z-axis. 0 = seating is flat, seat and vehicle z-axis are parallel. Positive degrees = seat tilted backwards, seat z-axis is tilted backward.

Issuer.description: Unique Issuer for the authentication of the occupant. E.g. https://accounts.funcorp.com.

Subject.description: Subject for the authentication of the occupant. E.g. UserID 7331677.

Position.description: Seat position on vehicle x-axis. Position is relative to the frontmost position supported by the seat. 0 = Frontmost position supported.

Length.description: Length adjustment of seating. 0 = Adjustable part of seating in rearmost position (Shortest length of seating).

Seating.comment: Seating is here considered as the part of the seat that supports the thighs. Additional cushions (if any) for support of lower legs is not covered by this branch.
Seating.description: Describes signals related to the seating/base of the seat.

IsLessSupportEngaged.description: Is switch for less lumbar support engaged (SingleSeat.Backrest.Lumbar.Support).

IsMoreSupportEngaged.description: Is switch for more lumbar support engaged (SingleSeat.Backrest.Lumbar.Support).

IsLessSupportEngaged.description: Is switch for less side bolster support engaged (SingleSeat.Backrest.SideBolster.Support).

IsMoreSupportEngaged.description: Is switch for more side bolster support engaged (SingleSeat.Backrest.SideBolster.Support).

Backrest.description: Describes switches related to the backrest of the seat.

IsBackwardEngaged.description: Is switch to decrease seating length engaged (SingleSeat.Seating.Length).

IsForwardEngaged.description: Is switch to increase seating length engaged (SingleSeat.Seating.Length).

Seating.description: Describes switches related to the seating of the seat.

Tilt.description: Tilting of seat relative to vehicle z-axis. 0 = seating is flat, seat and vehicle z-axis are parallel. Positive degrees = seat tilted backwards, seat z-axis is tilted backward.

SeatPosCount.comment: Default value corresponds to two seats in front row and 3 seats in second row.
SeatPosCount.description: Number of seats across each row from the front to the rear.

SeatRowCount.comment: Default value corresponds to two rows of seats.
SeatRowCount.description: Number of seat rows in vehicle.

Position.description: Sunroof position. 0 = Fully closed 100 = Fully opened. -100 = Fully tilted.
Position of window blind. 0 = Fully retracted. 100 = Fully deployed.

Switch.description: Switch controlling sliding action such as window, sunroof, or blind.
Switch controlling sliding action such as window, sunroof, or shade.

CargoVolume.description: The available volume for cargo or luggage. For automobiles, this is usually the trunk volume.

PedalPosition.description: Accelerator pedal position as percent. 0 = Not depressed. 100 = Fully depressed.

TireAspectRatio.description: Aspect ratio between tire section height and tire section width, as per ETRTO / TRA standard.

TireDiameter.description: Outer diameter of tires, in inches, as per ETRTO / TRA standard.

TireWidth.description: Nominal section width of tires, in mm, as per ETRTO / TRA standard.

FluidLevel.description: Brake fluid level as percent. 0 = Empty. 100 = Full.

IsBrakesWorn.description: Brake pad wear status. True = Worn. False = Not Worn.

IsFluidLevelLow.description: Brake fluid level status. True = Brake fluid level low. False = Brake fluid level OK.

PadWear.description: Brake pad wear as percent. 0 = No Wear. 100 = Worn.

IsPressureLow.description: Tire Pressure Status. True = Low tire pressure. False = Good tire pressure.

FluidLevel.description: Brake fluid level as percent. 0 = Empty. 100 = Full.

IsBrakesWorn.description: Brake pad wear status. True = Worn. False = Not Worn.

IsFluidLevelLow.description: Brake fluid level status. True = Brake fluid level low. False = Brake fluid level OK.

PadWear.description: Brake pad wear as percent. 0 = No Wear. 100 = Worn.

IsPressureLow.description: Tire Pressure Status. True = Low tire pressure. False = Good tire pressure.

WheelCount.description: Number of wheels on the axle

WheelDiameter.description: Diameter of wheels (rims without tires), in inches, as per ETRTO / TRA standard.

WheelWidth.description: Width of wheels (rims without tires), in inches, as per ETRTO / TRA standard.

TireAspectRatio.description: Aspect ratio between tire section height and tire section width, as per ETRTO / TRA standard.

TireDiameter.description: Outer diameter of tires, in inches, as per ETRTO / TRA standard.

TireWidth.description: Nominal section width of tires, in mm, as per ETRTO / TRA standard.

FluidLevel.description: Brake fluid level as percent. 0 = Empty. 100 = Full.

IsBrakesWorn.description: Brake pad wear status. True = Worn. False = Not Worn.

IsFluidLevelLow.description: Brake fluid level status. True = Brake fluid level low. False = Brake fluid level OK.

PadWear.description: Brake pad wear as percent. 0 = No Wear. 100 = Worn.

IsPressureLow.description: Tire Pressure Status. True = Low tire pressure. False = Good tire pressure.

FluidLevel.description: Brake fluid level as percent. 0 = Empty. 100 = Full.

IsBrakesWorn.description: Brake pad wear status. True = Worn. False = Not Worn.

IsFluidLevelLow.description: Brake fluid level status. True = Brake fluid level low. False = Brake fluid level OK.

PadWear.description: Brake pad wear as percent. 0 = No Wear. 100 = Worn.

IsPressureLow.description: Tire Pressure Status. True = Low tire pressure. False = Good tire pressure.

WheelCount.description: Number of wheels on the axle

WheelDiameter.description: Diameter of wheels (rims without tires), in inches, as per ETRTO / TRA standard.

WheelWidth.description: Width of wheels (rims without tires), in inches, as per ETRTO / TRA standard.

AxleCount.description: Number of axles on the vehicle

PedalPosition.description: Brake pedal position as percent. 0 = Not depressed. 100 = Fully depressed.

IsEngaged.description: Parking brake status. True = Parking Brake is Engaged. False = Parking Brake is not Engaged.

Angle.description: Steering wheel angle. Positive = degrees to the left. Negative = degrees to the right.

Extension.description: Steering wheel column extension from dashboard. 0 = Closest to dashboard. 100 = Furthest from dashboard.

Position.description: Position of the steering wheel on the left or right side of the vehicle.

Tilt.description: Steering wheel column tilt. 0 = Lowest position. 100 = Highest position.

Chassis.description: All data concerning steering, suspension, wheels, and brakes.

CurbWeight.description: Vehicle curb weight, including all liquids and full tank of fuel, but no cargo or passengers.

Altitude.description: Current altitude relative to WGS 84 reference ellipsoid.

Heading.description: Current heading relative to geographic north. 0 = North, 90 = East, 180 = South, 270 = West.

HorizontalAccuracy.description: Accuracy of the latitude and longitude coordinates.

Latitude.description: Current latitude of vehicle according to WGS 84.

Longitude.description: Current longitude of vehicle according to WGS 84.

Timestamp.description: Timestamp from GNSS system for current location, formatted according to ISO 8601 with UTC time zone.

CurrentLocation.description: The current latitude and longitude of the vehicle.

CurrentOverallWeight.description: Current overall Vehicle weight. Including passengers, cargo and other load inside the car.

AttentiveProbability.description: Probability of attentiveness of the driver.

DistractionLevel.description: Distraction level of the driver will be the level how much the driver is distracted, by multiple factors. E.g. Driving situation, acustical or optical signales inside the cockpit, phone calls.

FatigueLevel.description: Fatigueness level of driver. Evaluated by multiple factors like trip time, behaviour of steering, eye status.

Issuer.description: Unique Issuer for the authentication of the occupant. E.g. https://accounts.funcorp.com.

Subject.description: Subject for the authentication of the occupant. E.g. UserID 7331677.

IsEyesOnRoad.description: Has driver the eyes on road or not?

GrossWeight.description: Curb weight of vehicle, including all liquids and full tank of fuel and full load of cargo and passengers.

IsMoving.description: Indicates whether the vehicle is stationary or moving.

LowVoltageSystemState.description: State of the supply voltage of the control units (usually 12V).

MaxTowBallWeight.description: Maximum vertical weight on the tow ball of a trailer.

Temperature1.description: PID 3C - Catalyst temperature from bank 1, sensor 1

Temperature2.description: PID 3E - Catalyst temperature from bank 1, sensor 2

Temperature1.description: PID 3D - Catalyst temperature from bank 2, sensor 1

Temperature2.description: PID 3F - Catalyst temperature from bank 2, sensor 2

DTCList.description: List of currently active DTCs formatted according OBD II (SAE-J2012DA_201812) standard ([P|C|B|U]XXXXX )

DistanceSinceDTCClear.description: PID 31 - Distance traveled since codes cleared

DistanceWithMIL.description: PID 21 - Distance traveled with MIL on

IgnitionType.description: Type of the ignition for ICE - spark = spark plug ignition, compression = self-igniting (Diesel engines)

IsMILOn.description: Malfunction Indicator Light (MIL) - False = Off, True = On

DriveCycleStatus.description: PID 41 - OBD status for the current drive cycle

EVAPVaporPressureAbsolute.description: PID 53 - Absolute evaporative purge (EVAP) system pressure

EVAPVaporPressureAlternate.description: PID 54 - Alternate evaporative purge (EVAP) system pressure

EngineLoad.description: PID 04 - Engine load in percent - 0 = no load, 100 = full load

EngineSpeed.description: PID 0C - Engine speed measured as rotations per minute

EthanolPercent.description: PID 52 - Percentage of ethanol in the fuel

FreezeDTC.description: PID 02 - DTC that triggered the freeze frame

FuelLevel.description: PID 2F - Fuel level in the fuel tank

FuelRailPressureDirect.description: PID 23 - Fuel rail pressure direct inject

FuelRailPressureVac.description: PID 22 - Fuel rail pressure relative to vacuum

HybridBatteryRemaining.description: PID 5B - Remaining life of hybrid battery

IsPTOActive.description: PID 1E - Auxiliary input status (power take off)

LongTermFuelTrim1.description: PID 07 - Long Term (learned) Fuel Trim - Bank 1 - negative percent leaner, positive percent richer

LongTermFuelTrim2.description: PID 09 - Long Term (learned) Fuel Trim - Bank 2 - negative percent leaner, positive percent richer

LongTermO2Trim1.description: PID 56 (byte A) - Long term secondary O2 trim - Bank 1

LongTermO2Trim2.description: PID 58 (byte A) - Long term secondary O2 trim - Bank 2

LongTermO2Trim3.description: PID 56 (byte B) - Long term secondary O2 trim - Bank 3

LongTermO2Trim4.description: PID 58 (byte B) - Long term secondary O2 trim - Bank 4

MAF.description: PID 10 - Grams of air drawn into engine per second

MaxMAF.description: PID 50 - Maximum flow for mass air flow sensor

ShortTermFuelTrim.description: PID 1x (byte B) - Short term fuel trim
PID 1x (byte B) - Short term fuel trim
PID 1x (byte B) - Short term fuel trim
PID 1x (byte B) - Short term fuel trim
PID 1x (byte B) - Short term fuel trim
PID 1x (byte B) - Short term fuel trim
PID 1x (byte B) - Short term fuel trim
PID 1x (byte B) - Short term fuel trim

Current.description: PID 3x (byte CD) - Current for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Lambda.description: PID 2x (byte AB) and PID 3x (byte AB) - Lambda for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Voltage.description: PID 2x (byte CD) - Voltage for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Sensor1.description: Wide range/band oxygen sensors (PID 24 - 2B and PID 34 - 3B)

Current.description: PID 3x (byte CD) - Current for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Lambda.description: PID 2x (byte AB) and PID 3x (byte AB) - Lambda for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Voltage.description: PID 2x (byte CD) - Voltage for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Sensor2.description: Wide range/band oxygen sensors (PID 24 - 2B and PID 34 - 3B)

Current.description: PID 3x (byte CD) - Current for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Lambda.description: PID 2x (byte AB) and PID 3x (byte AB) - Lambda for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Voltage.description: PID 2x (byte CD) - Voltage for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Sensor3.description: Wide range/band oxygen sensors (PID 24 - 2B and PID 34 - 3B)

Current.description: PID 3x (byte CD) - Current for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Lambda.description: PID 2x (byte AB) and PID 3x (byte AB) - Lambda for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Voltage.description: PID 2x (byte CD) - Voltage for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Sensor4.description: Wide range/band oxygen sensors (PID 24 - 2B and PID 34 - 3B)

Current.description: PID 3x (byte CD) - Current for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Lambda.description: PID 2x (byte AB) and PID 3x (byte AB) - Lambda for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Voltage.description: PID 2x (byte CD) - Voltage for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Sensor5.description: Wide range/band oxygen sensors (PID 24 - 2B and PID 34 - 3B)

Current.description: PID 3x (byte CD) - Current for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Lambda.description: PID 2x (byte AB) and PID 3x (byte AB) - Lambda for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Voltage.description: PID 2x (byte CD) - Voltage for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Sensor6.description: Wide range/band oxygen sensors (PID 24 - 2B and PID 34 - 3B)

Current.description: PID 3x (byte CD) - Current for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Lambda.description: PID 2x (byte AB) and PID 3x (byte AB) - Lambda for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Voltage.description: PID 2x (byte CD) - Voltage for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Sensor7.description: Wide range/band oxygen sensors (PID 24 - 2B and PID 34 - 3B)

Current.description: PID 3x (byte CD) - Current for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Lambda.description: PID 2x (byte AB) and PID 3x (byte AB) - Lambda for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Voltage.description: PID 2x (byte CD) - Voltage for wide range/band oxygen sensor

Sensor8.description: Wide range/band oxygen sensors (PID 24 - 2B and PID 34 - 3B)

O2WR.description: Wide range/band oxygen sensors (PID 24 - 2B and PID 34 - 3B)

OBDStandards.description: PID 1C - OBD standards this vehicle conforms to

OxygenSensorsIn2Banks.description: PID 13 - Presence of oxygen sensors in 2 banks. [A0..A3] == Bank 1, Sensors 1-4. [A4..A7] == Bank 2, Sensors 1-4

OxygenSensorsIn4Banks.description: PID 1D - Presence of oxygen sensors in 4 banks. Similar to PID 13, but [A0..A7] == [B1S1, B1S2, B2S1, B2S2, B3S1, B3S2, B4S1, B4S2]

PidsA.description: PID 00 - Bit array of the supported pids 01 to 20

PidsB.description: PID 20 - Bit array of the supported pids 21 to 40

PidsC.description: PID 40 - Bit array of the supported pids 41 to 60

RunTimeMIL.description: PID 4D - Run time with MIL on

ShortTermFuelTrim1.description: PID 06 - Short Term (immediate) Fuel Trim - Bank 1 - negative percent leaner, positive percent richer

ShortTermFuelTrim2.description: PID 08 - Short Term (immediate) Fuel Trim - Bank 2 - negative percent leaner, positive percent richer

ShortTermO2Trim1.description: PID 55 (byte A) - Short term secondary O2 trim - Bank 1

ShortTermO2Trim2.description: PID 57 (byte A) - Short term secondary O2 trim - Bank 2

ShortTermO2Trim3.description: PID 55 (byte B) - Short term secondary O2 trim - Bank 3

ShortTermO2Trim4.description: PID 57 (byte B) - Short term secondary O2 trim - Bank 4

IgnitionType.description: Type of the ignition for ICE - spark = spark plug ignition, compression = self-igniting (Diesel engines)

IsMILOn.description: Malfunction Indicator Light (MIL) False = Off, True = On

ThrottlePosition.description: PID 11 - Throttle position - 0 = closed throttle, 100 = open throttle

TimeSinceDTCCleared.description: PID 4E - Time since trouble codes cleared

WarmupsSinceDTCClear.description: PID 30 - Number of warm-ups since codes cleared

AccumulatedBrakingEnergy.description: The accumulated energy from regenerative braking over lifetime.

AspirationType.description: Type of aspiration (natural, turbocharger, supercharger etc).

CompressionRatio.description: Engine compression ratio, specified in the format 'X:1', e.g. '9.2:1'.

Capacity.description: Capacity in liters of the Diesel Exhaust Fluid Tank.

IsLevelLow.description: Indicates if the Diesel Exhaust Fluid level is low. True if level is low. Definition of low is vehicle dependent.

Level.description: Level of the Diesel Exhaust Fluid tank as percent of capacity. 0 = empty. 100 = full.

Range.description: Remaining range in meters of the Diesel Exhaust Fluid present in the vehicle.

DieselExhaustFluid.comment: In retail and marketing other names are typically used for the fluid.
DieselExhaustFluid.description: Signals related to Diesel Exhaust Fluid (DEF). DEF is called AUS32 in ISO 22241.

DeltaPressure.description: Delta Pressure of Diesel Particulate Filter.

InletTemperature.description: Inlet temperature of Diesel Particulate Filter.

OutletTemperature.description: Outlet temperature of Diesel Particulate Filter.

EngineCode.comment: For hybrid vehicles the engine code may refer to the combination of combustion and electric engine.
EngineCode.description: Engine code designation, as specified by vehicle manufacturer.

EngineHours.description: Accumulated time during engine lifetime with 'engine speed (rpm) > 0'.

IdleHours.comment: Vehicles may calculate accumulated idle time for an engine. It might be based on engine speed (rpm) below a certain limit or any other mechanism.
IdleHours.description: Accumulated idling time during engine lifetime. Definition of idling is not standardized.

IsRunning.description: Engine Running. True if engine is rotating (Speed > 0).

MAF.description: Grams of air drawn into engine per second.

MAP.description: Manifold absolute pressure possibly boosted using forced induction.

MaxPower.description: Peak power, in kilowatts, that engine can generate.

MaxTorque.description: Peak torque, in newton meter, that the engine can generate.

OilLifeRemaining.comment: In addition to this a signal a vehicle can report remaining time to service (including e.g. oil change) by Vehicle.Service.TimeToService.
OilLifeRemaining.description: Remaining engine oil life in seconds. Negative values can be used to indicate that lifetime has been exceeded.

Power.description: Current engine power output. Shall be reported as 0 during engine breaking.

Speed.description: Engine speed measured as rotations per minute.

Torque.comment: During engine breaking the engine delivers a negative torque to the transmission. This negative torque shall be ignored, instead 0 shall be reported.
Torque.description: Current engine torque. Shall be reported as 0 during engine breaking.

CombustionEngine.description: Engine-specific data, stopping at the bell housing.

EngineCode.description: Engine code designation, as specified by vehicle manufacturer.

MaxPower.description: Peak power, in kilowatts, that motor(s) can generate.

MaxRegenPower.description: Peak regen/brake power, in kilowatts, that motor(s) can generate.

MaxRegenTorque.description: Peak regen/brake torque, in newton meter, that the motor(s) can generate.

MaxTorque.description: Peak power, in newton meter, that the motor(s) can generate.

Power.description: Current motor power output. Negative values indicate regen mode.

Rpm.description: Motor rotational speed measured as rotations per minute. Negative values indicate reverse driving mode.

Torque.description: Current motor torque. Negative values indicate regen mode.

AverageConsumption.description: Average consumption in liters per 100 km.

ConsumptionSinceStart.description: Fuel amount in liters consumed since start of current trip.

HybridType.description: Defines the hybrid type of the vehicle.

InstantConsumption.description: Current consumption in liters per 100 km.

IsEngineStopStartEnabled.description: Indicates whether eco start stop is currently enabled.

IsFuelLevelLow.description: Indicates that the fuel level is low (e.g. <50km range).

Level.description: Level in fuel tank as percent of capacity. 0 = empty. 100 = full.

Range.description: Remaining range in meters using only liquid fuel.

SupportedFuel.comment: RON 95 is sometimes referred to as Super, RON 98 as Super Plus.
SupportedFuel.description: Detailed information on fuels supported by the vehicle. Identifiers originating from DIN EN 16942:2021-08, appendix B, with additional suffix for octane (RON) where relevant.

SupportedFuelTypes.comment: If a vehicle also has an electric drivetrain (e.g. hybrid) that will be obvious from the PowerTrain.Type signal.
SupportedFuelTypes.description: High level information of fuel types supported

TankCapacity.description: Capacity of the fuel tank in liters.

TimeSinceStart.description: Time in seconds elapsed since start of current trip.

Range.description: Remaining range in meters using all energy sources available in the vehicle.

AccumulatedChargedEnergy.description: The accumulated energy delivered to the battery during charging over lifetime of the battery.

AccumulatedConsumedEnergy.description: The accumulated energy leaving HV battery for propulsion and auxiliary loads over lifetime of the battery.

ChargeLimit.description: Maximum charge level for battery, can potentially be set manually.

ChargePlugType.comment: IEC_TYPE_1_AC refers to Type 1 as defined in IEC 62196-2. Also known as Yazaki or J1772 connector. IEC_TYPE_2_AC refers to Type 2 as defined in IEC 62196-2. Also known as Mennekes connector. IEC_TYPE_3_AC refers to Type 3 as defined in IEC 62196-2. Also known as Scame connector. IEC_TYPE_4_DC refers to AA configuration as defined in IEC 62196-3. Also known as Type 4 or CHAdeMO connector. IEC_TYPE_1_CCS_DC refers to EE Configuration as defined in IEC 62196-3. Also known as CCS1 or Combo1 connector. IEC_TYPE_2_CCS_DC refers to FF Configuration as defined in IEC 62196-3. Also known as CCS2 or Combo2 connector. TESLA_ROADSTER, TESLA_HPWC (High Power Wall Connector) and TESLA_SUPERCHARGER refer to non-standardized charging plugs/methods used by Tesla. GBT_AC refers to connector specified in GB/T 20234.2. GBT_DC refers to connector specified in GB/T 20234.3. Also specified as BB Configuration in IEC 62196-3. OTHER shall be used if the vehicle has a charging connector, but not one of the connectors listed above. For additional information see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEC_62196.
ChargePlugType.description: Type of charge plug (charging connector) available on the vehicle. IEC types refer to IEC 62196,  GBT refers to  GB/T 20234.

ChargePortFlap.description: Status of the charge port cover, can potentially be controlled manually.

ChargeRate.description: Current charging rate, as in kilometers of range added per hour.

IsCharging.description: True if charging is ongoing. Charging is considered to be ongoing if energy is flowing from charger to vehicle.

IsChargingCableConnected.description: Indicates if a charging cable is connected to the vehicle or not.

MaximumChargingCurrent.description: Maximum charging current that can be accepted by the system.

Mode.description: Control of the charge process - manually initiated (plug-in event, companion app, etc), timer-based or grid-controlled (eg ISO 15118).

StartStopCharging.description: Start or stop the charging process.

TimeToComplete.comment: Shall consider time set by Charging.Timer.Time. E.g. if charging shall start in 3 hours and 2 hours of charging is needed, then Charging.TimeToComplete shall report 5 hours.
TimeToComplete.description: The time needed for the current charging process to reach StateOfCharge.Target. 0 if charging is complete or no charging process is active or planned.

Mode.description: Defines timer mode for charging: INACTIVE - no timer set, charging may start as soon as battery is connected to a charger. START_TIME - charging shall start at Charging.Timer.Time. END_TIME - charging shall be finished (reach StateOfCharge.Target) at Charging.Timer.Time. When charging is completed the vehicle shall change mode to 'inactive' or set a new Charging.Timer.Time. Charging shall start immediately if mode is 'starttime' or 'endtime' and Charging.Timer.Time is a time in the past.

Time.description: Time for next charging-related action, formatted according to ISO 8601 with UTC time zone. Value has no significance if Charging.Timer.Mode is 'inactive'.

Timer.description: Properties related to timing of battery charging sessions.

IsGroundConnected.comment: It might be possible to disconnect the traction battery used by an electric powertrain. This is achieved by connectors, typically one for plus and one for minus.
IsGroundConnected.description: Indicating if the ground (negative terminator) of the traction battery is connected to the powertrain.

IsPowerConnected.comment: It might be possible to disconnect the traction battery used by an electric powertrain. This is achieved by connectors, typically one for plus and one for minus.
IsPowerConnected.description: Indicating if the power (positive terminator) of the traction battery is connected to the powertrain.

Range.description: Remaining range in meters using only battery.

Current.description: Physical state of charge of the high voltage battery. This is not necessarily the state of charge being displayed to the customer.

Displayed.description: State of charge displayed to the customer.

Target.description: Target state of charge set (eg. by customer). Shall never exceed Charging.ChargeLimit.

StateOfCharge.description: Information on the state of charge of the vehicle's high voltage battery.

ClutchEngagement.description: Clutch engagement. 0% = Clutch fully disengaged. 100% = Clutch fully engaged.

ClutchWear.description: Clutch wear as a percent. 0 = no wear. 100 = worn.

DiffLockFrontEngagement.description: Front Diff Lock engagement. 0% = Diff lock fully disengaged. 100% = Diff lock fully engaged.

DiffLockRearEngagement.description: Rear Diff Lock engagement. 0% = Diff lock fully disengaged. 100% = Diff lock fully engaged.

GearChangeMode.description: Is the gearbox in automatic or manual (paddle) mode.

GearCount.description: Number of forward gears in the transmission. -1 = CVT.

IsElectricalPowertrainEngaged.comment: In some hybrid solutions it is possible to disconnect/disengage the electrical powertrain mechanically to avoid induced voltage reaching a too high level when driving at high speed.
IsElectricalPowertrainEngaged.description: Is electrical powertrain mechanically connected/engaged to the drivetrain or not. False = Disconnected/Disengaged. True = Connected/Engaged.

IsLowRangeEngaged.comment: The possibility to switch between low and high gear range is typically only available in heavy vehicles and off-road vehicles.
IsLowRangeEngaged.description: Is gearbox in low range mode or not. False = Normal/High range engaged. True = Low range engaged.

IsParkLockEngaged.description: Is the transmission park lock engaged or not. False = Disengaged. True = Engaged.

TorqueDistribution.description: Torque distribution between front and rear axle in percent. -100% = Full torque to front axle, 0% = 50:50 Front/Rear, 100% = Full torque to rear axle.

TravelledDistance.description: Odometer reading, total distance travelled during the lifetime of the transmission.

Transmission.description: Transmission-specific data, stopping at the drive shafts.

Type.comment: For vehicles with a combustion engine (including hybrids) more detailed information on fuels supported can be found in FuelSystem.SupportedFuelTypes and FuelSystem.SupportedFuels.
Type.description: Defines the powertrain type of the vehicle.

Powertrain.description: Powertrain data for battery management, etc.

Private.description: Uncontrolled branch where non-public signals can be defined.

RoofLoad.description: The permitted total weight of cargo and installations (e.g. a roof rack) on top of the vehicle.

DistanceToService.description: Remaining distance to service (of any kind). Negative values indicate service overdue.

IsServiceDue.description: Indicates if vehicle needs service (of any kind). True = Service needed now or in the near future. False = No known need for service.

TimeToService.description: Remaining time to service (of any kind). Negative values indicate service overdue.

IsConnected.description: Signal indicating if trailer is connected or not.

TravelledDistance.description: Odometer reading, total distance travelled during the lifetime of the vehicle.

AcrissCode.description: The ACRISS Car Classification Code is a code used by many car rental companies.

BodyType.description: Indicates the design and body style of the vehicle (e.g. station wagon, hatchback, etc.).

DateVehicleFirstRegistered.description: The date in ISO 8601 format of the first registration of the vehicle with the respective public authorities.

KnownVehicleDamages.description: A textual description of known damages, both repaired and unrepaired.

MeetsEmissionStandard.description: Indicates that the vehicle meets the respective emission standard.

ProductionDate.description: The date in ISO 8601 format of production of the item, e.g. vehicle.

PurchaseDate.description: The date in ISO 8601 format of the item e.g. vehicle was purchased by the current owner.

VIN.description: 17-character Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) as defined by ISO 3779.

VehicleConfiguration.description: A short text indicating the configuration of the vehicle, e.g. '5dr hatchback ST 2.5 MT 225 hp' or 'limited edition'.

VehicleInteriorColor.description: The color or color combination of the interior of the vehicle.

VehicleInteriorType.description: The type or material of the interior of the vehicle (e.g. synthetic fabric, leather, wood, etc.).

VehicleModelDate.description: The release date in ISO 8601 format of a vehicle model (often used to differentiate versions of the same make and model).

VehicleSeatingCapacity.description: The number of passengers that can be seated in the vehicle, both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.

VehicleSpecialUsage.description: Indicates whether the vehicle has been used for special purposes, like commercial rental, driving school.

WMI.description: 3-character World Manufacturer Identification (WMI) as defined by ISO 3780.

Label.description: Label to further describe the version.

Major.description: Supported Version of VSS - Major version.

Minor.description: Supported Version of VSS - Minor version.

Patch.description: Supported Version of VSS - Patch version.
